page.title: 04Some changes in Beckermet
page.content: Beckermet has grown enormously over the past 50 years. Several small private housing estates have been built round its perimeter. If new people didn't come into the village, there wouldn't be a village. If too many people came into the village, it would lose its village aspect and start looking like a town. The new road has improved the village. Now, as there is not much traffic, Beckermet is a safer place. There was a railway in Beckermet with 5 trains a day to Whitehaven. The railway was opened in 1869 and closed in 1964 because of competition from the buses. There was a telephone in 1889. The first public telephone box was on the Millfields but then it was moved to the park in the centre of the village because it was getting vandalised.
